Not as bad as people say
review_detailed_main: This movie does hold your attention. Not great, but not a regret either.

As a fan of the original creepypasta Slenderman stories I was pleasantly surprised and glad on how they went about portraying certain aspects of Slenderman. Though this movie met my expectations, they were not very high in the first place. On the other hand it is definitely the best Slenderman full length movie adaptation I've seen and I was very happy that they kept it as close to the creepypasta as they did. That being said, the main story itself was not too incredible, nor horrible for that matter. Although this movie wasn't absolutely amazing, they definitely could've done much, much worse.

I thought for what seemed to be an amateur film: it had a lot of interesting film effects used throughout the movie, and most were put to reasonably good use. I thought the girls did a good job acting despite their younger age. The movie just suffers from lack of plot design, not making any real references to the videogame or to the lore and fandom, which I would have really appreciated if they did. About 2/3 the way in the movie just slows down too much, but the beginning and ending were sustainable. Overall a good attempt at a movie for someone obviously less experienced, but a lot can still be had.
Liars! The 50% of the trailer is missing from the movie, the best scenes why I went to watch it! Cheaters, that is the deception of the audience!

review_title: An Unfortunate Mess that could've been something.
review_detailed_main:
The worst thing about how utterly bad this film is, is how wonderful the cinematography (in spite of the horrible CGI and horrid script) and the Soundtrack were.

They had so much potential to be utilized with slender man, but made so many horrible choices with the liberties taken on the Lore.

The acting borders from, "ok" to "shamefully bad", and the script was just horrendous. It's so all over the place, and the potholes grow larger every minute.

The film also suffers from trying to stay tame in order to keep the rating safe for kids to be able to attend. It goes so far down the safety hole that it's almost more PG than PG-13. There's no gore, sex, or nudity. The only thing I can think of to maybe justify Pg-13 over PG is that one kid says, "fuck" once. (They say "frick" other times... seriously) it's just way too timid, and it borders on being flat out boring.

The often beautiful shots (when they're not raped by hideously cheap CGI) and fantastic soundtrack are all that kept me from passing out into a boredom induced coma.

They repeatedly try for the cliche jump scares, but you see them a mile off. It just fails on so many levels, and it's frustrating because at the root of it all, they really could've made something brilliant if they hadn't succumbed to being lazy, safe, and cliche.

I'd say a generous 4 out of 10 and only for the cinematography and score which really are wasted on a turd of a film. The rest is just a sloppy mess.

review_title: It was better than Boogey Man

review_detailed_main: If I could rate this a zero, I would. I was hoping that this film would at least be "so bad it's good" but it literally has nothing going for it. Bad acting, shocking script, no scares. Stay away from this trash. It's not entertaining on any level.

review_title: Amazing!!! Easily one of the best movies ever made!
review_detailed_main: First off all of the comments about how this movie are bad are just being mean. This movie was full of heart and had lots of work put into it to present the audience with the best representation of slender man known to man. Regarding the movie, the beginning starts slow and offers some of the best storytelling I have ever had the privilege of witnessing. After a good intro filled with laughs and a reprenstation of high schoolers that very accurately tells of how I had spent high school it goes into the actual movie and how slenderman slowly inserts himself into the minds of curious kids who think that the supernatural and it's influences are just games. Through a series of intense sequences of dialog and quick scenes of suspense the directors make use of the greatest influence of literary influence also known as pathos to get the viewers to not even want to blink so they won't miss anything. Many people dislike this movie but I believe that is just the mob mentality holding the them from wanting to physically express their love for this masterpiece. I could go on and on about all the things that make this movie a future legend but I am going to stop myself at just saying that this movie is a must see and I strongly reccomend anyone who wants to go to the movies and see something that will keep them on the edge of their seat while delivering easily the best movie that has ever been made.

review_title: Obviously nothing special or original, but watchable enough if you like horror movies.
review_detailed_main:
'SLENDER MAN': Three Stars (Out of Five)



A horror flick about a group of high school girls who attempt to prove that Slender Man (a popular internet supernatural character) doesn't actually exist, and then one of them turns up missing. It was directed by Sylvain White, written by David Birke, and it stars Joey King, Goldani Telles, Jaz Sinclair, Annalise Basso and Javier Botet (in the title role). The film did well at the Box Office, but it got horrible reviews from critics and moviegoers. I thought it was decently made, and effective in some ways. It's obviously nothing special or original though, but watchable enough if you like horror movies.

Slender Man is a poor teen horror movie with a troubled production. It had post production editing where scenes from the movie trailer were absent from the final product.

Four bored teenage girls in a small town in Massachusetts summon the internet meme of the Slender Man. They want to prove that he does not exist.

Soon people start to go missing. There is a shadowy thin figure lurking.

The movie is a combination of Candy Ma and The Ring. Unfortunately the film is inept and dull.

There are a couple of creepy scenes but you might better off seeing the films that inspired it.
Feels like a lot of content was cut, the characters are only relatable to middle and high schoolers, too much reliance on CG, formulaic, utter waste of time.

I knew right from the get go, that this was going to be bad. I basically just watched the movie, because a friend wanted me to go with him. The worst thing about the movie is it's boringness. The 90 minutes felt like 2 hours. Aside from that, the movie was predictable, laughable and und dumb. Pretty much every horror cliche was used in the screenplay, I guess. The characters were actually no characters due to non existent personality. Worst thing was by far how they depicted Slenderman on screen. They used CGI to create him and obviously didn't had the budget or talent to make him look realistic. When you could actually see him in all his "glory" at the end, he remembered me of a not fully rendered character from an animated movie of the 2000s. That's the reason for the horrible pun in my review-title. If you really want to watch this terrible flick, than look out for the date scene with our protagonist's boyfriend. It's hilariously bad.

So, I just saw Slenderman and wish I hadn't. This easily is one of the most boring horror flicks I've ever seen, to the point where I'd would say that any low budget Hong Kong Martial Arts movie is way more entertaining.

I kinda have pity with the actors in the movie having to portrait rather generic and bland characters. The only good thing about the movie was the music. Other than that the atmosphere was boring, cheap effects and weak jump scares that wouldn't even scare a child.

There really is a LOT of missed opportunity here for a decent horror movie based on the Slenderman myth... but instead they just wasted their time and created a crappy film you should forget about and rather read some creepy pastas about Slenderman, since they will definitely get you more spooked than this.

review_title: A movie made in a hurry...
review_detailed_main: The plot didn't have any clear direction, as if they just rushed to make this movie and get it out to the public.
Not the best acting. Story could've been better. Boring/weird ending

review_title: Wasn't as bad as I had anticipated... But still bad nonetheless
review_detailed_main:
While I can't understand why anyone would release a Slenderman movie in 2018, I didn't think it was as bad as people made out to be. If this was made in 2011 or 2012 when Slenderman was actually relevant I would imagine it would've been huge box office success, it'd still probably be bad but the hype would've helped carry and help with the succession.

The writing, first and foremost was unforgivably cringey. In the first ten minutes there's pieces of dialogue that I've never heard any real people say, let alone a bunch of fifteen year olds. It lives into endless bad horror movie cliches with both the characters, dialogue and cheap jump scares but manages to savour some sort of dignity with the occasional scenic shot. I'm sure if this was a 12A young tweens would be terrified by this for the best part of a year but as a 15, for the people who were around for the Slenderman phenomenon who are mostly in their 20s now Will just this mundane, cringey and tiresome.

Worth a watch if you're interested but it's mostly a waste of time.

review_title: What a pile of foul smelling garbage
review_detailed_main: I really have nothing to say about this film. It's that bland. The difference between it and TV static is that I don't have any hopes from static. Imagine some guys doing scary video bits on TikTok, like five or six of them, then thinking about how to turn them into a full feature movie. So they take a bunch of teenage looking girls, write a nonsensical script and have them run around like headless chickens. At random intervals they add the TikTok videos. Film done!

WTF is wrong with ppl rating this movie so low. It's intense, unsettling, original & even unpleasant at times. Nothing is ever good for anyone. For me, the visual effects like rapid shapeshifting of faces was real scary. It's definitely well made.

review_title: Everyone is so hypercritical, it's ridiculous
review_detailed_main:
This movie has less jump scares and more of a creepy and ominous atmosphere. This movie was pretty good for a flick filled with a sub-par script, but remember, teenage girls sound cringey anyway... so chill.

Take this movie with a grain of salt. It's good for what it is. It's job is to portray a creepy figure that taps into the psyche of susceptible prey and torments them. This movie explores exactly that.

There's nothing outstanding about this film. Although, the sound design and visuals are pretty well done. This definitely isn't the worst horror movie I've seen. It's not poorly made and it wasn't super laughable either. If you have some free time, go see this for sure.

Cute girls, horrible acting , and nothing scary. Some scenes were ok but otherwise then that, nothing to offer. The slenderman was not scary, his story wasnt scary. Only thing that was horrifying is that a film studio gave the writers and directors to make this ass of a movie.

So I came into this movie thinking it was going to be scary. But I also heard other people saying it wasn't. So I started watching it and fell asleep watching the movie. It was not scary at all and it was very boring. I felt like there was no plot.

The movie was kinda okay while I was watching it but I dont like the fact that they are scaring us with jumpscares and they are all the same for me ... and also I dont like the ending its kinda unexplained for me .. so my point is its kinda scary while you watch it ..?

review_title: DO MOT WASTE MONEY ON THIS FILM

review_detailed_main: Don't waste your time.more of a comedy then horror film.

review_title: Loud noises aren't scary - just annoying!
review_detailed_main: Slender Man (aka Cliche - the movie) is not only incredibly lacking in any scares, but also fails in telling an even close to interesting story that apparently can't even get its own lore straight. Add to that a bunch of cardboard cutouts trying to pass off as characters (that the movie itself doesn't even seem to care that much about), special effects that outright made me laugh out loud, jump scares you can set a timer to, and you've got a horror movie that fails on practically every single level. Did I mention it even has the dream within a dream scare? Well, of course it does, because this movie hasn't got anything you haven't seen before done many times better. The only reason I didn't fall asleep was because the movie insisted on using sound effects so obnoxiously loud I was constantly fearing it would permanently impair my hearing. It is a testament to a movie's lack of self confidence in being able to create a creepy atmosphere when it has to do it with loud noises and quick cuts to what I suppose was meant to be "unsettling" stuff, which just ends up coming across as laughable and unfortunately rather pathetic. This movie is sadly not so bad it's good - it's just plain bad!
An unfinished movie not worth seeing. A good idea poorly executed, Could of made a good found footage movie In the hands with more talented filmmakers.

review_title: Why this is so underrated? Was it really that bad? - I don't think so
review_detailed_main: Same here, I enjoyed this movie! The only thing which was slightly bothersome was the lighting of the movie, it was pitch black. But other than that it was OK! And it had a PLOT! Acting: well again, not that bad. Sorry you can be too picky in this genre and all in all this was a decent entry. Ps: people who complains that they did not get it what was this film about, READ and learn more about this dark internet meme :)

review_title: It's not that bad: it has some scary parts
review_detailed_main: This movie is definitely watchable. Oscar worthy? Definitely not but worth a watch. There is always something inherently scary about something based on true events that revolves around urban legends. The people who have it negative reviews? I bet they wouldn't dare try to conjure Slender Man so in essence, the movie did its job.

All the hate surrounding it kind of got me curious, along with the creepypasta backstory. Since I had time to kill, and a cinema nearby. I decided I would check it out. While you could say it's past its used by date, a good 5 years or so, when this titular being was the talk of the net. And the stigma of a true-to-life attempted murder in the name of the slender man means unwanted negative attention. Still the story could be effective if in the right hands, but 'Slender Man' mostly drops the ball with something rather superficial, and quickly produced with the feeling of wanting to forget and move on.

I found it simply mediocre... dreary, yet glossed up horror with plenty of blank stares... well, outside a nervy Joey King performance. There are terrible elements sure (e.g the dialogues and pacing), but i didn't hate myself for seeing it. Some slick atmospheric visuals (in spite of all the dark shadowy cinematography), effective sound design (snapping branches & trees rustling in the wind) and a chopped up feel to the narrative's structure (despite not purposely doing it thanks to studio interference in the editing room) kind of gave off a disorienting dreamscape logic blurring time and space of random scene transitions and incomplete character arcs that "for me" kinda worked. It had a "feel in the blanks'' structure with a lot of foreshadowing. A real mess of sorts and little in the way of Slender Man frights, but those few moments, especially involving King showed promise. It actually had me thinking of Wes Craven's 'My Soul to Take', especially the dreamlike air playing around with the character's gradual loss of reality, and the encroaching fear that sees them caught up in a nightmare of no escape. Once he comes calling, there's no going back.

I would be interested in seeing the full uncut version though. Would it make it any better, I don't know (...plot coherence probably), but I have a feeling the tone would be different especially those cut scenes which were in the first trailer.
Don't waste your time and money on this garbage. No storyline and very boring !

1-bad acting 2-way too much slender man 3-CGI is deceiving 4-movie is way too long for useless dialog

Don't go see it, just play the game.

This movie was so bad. It wasn't scary in anyway, the acting was bad and slender man was bad CGI the whole time. So many things were left unanswered and the ending was one of the worst I have ever seen. I usually accept horror movies for what they are but this one was down right awful. I hoped it was a movie so bad it could turn funny... Nope, it's just pure boredom on film.

Avoid it, it's not worth your time.

Very good,but with very little scary moments, not that bad as grade says, i recommend the movie

As soon as I saw this was rated PG-13 I knew it wouldn't be all it could have. That being said, it wasn't a bad movie. There were some parts that were childish horror, but it had a good plot and played that out most of the time.

review_title: Horrible but not in a good way

review_title: WARNING FOR THOSE WITH EPILEPSY AND/OR SENSORY SENSITIVITIES
review_detailed_main: For starters, the movie wasn't that great. It was kind of boring and the ending sucked. It wasn't entirely scary either. However, there seems to be very little warnings on the internet about a couple scenes that involve flashing lights and/or flashing imagery. They don't last very long, but the only warnings I saw were at the movie theater and before the movie. I researched for information about any sensory warnings for the movie and didn't find anything. So please be aware of it before going to see the movie. There are a couple scenes with flashing lights and/or imagery that could affect somebody with epilepsy or sensory sensitivities, and I haven't found many warnings on the internet about it.

review_title: Would be good if the movie had the scenes advertised
review_detailed_main: Like 60-70% of the commercials for this movie are NOT in the movie. Its boring, slow, and its clear they cut at least 20-30% of the film to ensure a pg-13 rating (or some other bizarre reason) so the story is absolutely butchered and nothing happens most the time

When you decide to make a horror film, actually produce said horror film... it makes no sense to then chicken out and CUT all the horror from the film and release what is left. Anything spooky is gone. All the violence is gone. Entire characters are removed from the film (because they die, obviously, sad-face). Sony has gone and done a massive goof again, accelerating their decent down the drain. Avoid this film like the plague.

This is a very boring, predictable and dumb film with a bad acting and terrible script.

Of the pluses I can mention the soundtrack.

I do not advise anyone to look.

I see the effort, I see how the actors tried to do the best they could. But honestly, it was not worth the time I spent watching this. The movie drags itself, has almost no pacing, and most importantly: Is not scary. Look, I'm scared of the dark. I'm scared of damn wasps. No matter how easily scared I am, this movie didn't even menage to scare me. There are plenty of good horror movies, don't watch the ones based on internet creepypasta unless you hear that it has stellar reviews.

I can only assume that the reviewers who called this film the "scariest film ever" are joking, or have never watched another horror film. This film is beyond dull!

The acting is wooden. The story is weak and full of holes. And it's as scary as Mickey Mouse.

Save your time! Go and do something more entertaining......like watching paint dry.
This movie is bland, not scary and just plain bad. Dont bother. Some of the scenes are so pitch black you cannot even see whats happening. Maybe thats a good thing cause its that bad.

review_title: Saw this yesterday, a great movie!
review_detailed_main: Sure, have your opinion, but my opinion: it was a great movie! Sure, this might do bad in sales in November (which is the Blu-ray and digital release date) my dad thought it was alright, I thought it was a great movie! I barely was even scared, I was only scared of the 2 previews, Overlord and The Nun, But anyways, this movie was awesome! I'm looking forward to the release date on Blu-ray!

review_title: About all anyone could really expect from the Slenderman concept and nowhere near worthy of a 3.1 avg. rating.
review_detailed_main: 5.7/10 Honestly people are being way too harsh to this film calling it the 'worst horror they'd ever seen", and just being completely extreme and vague in their "criticism" without actual legitimate explanations why they hated it. While it definitely isn't a good film overall, it's about the best portrayal you could expect from an internet horror concept which is essentially a very creepy tall faceless figure that takes children and is seen in old pictures that have been clearly photoshopped. The concept is creepy but really has no complexity or depth. This film at least delivers that same ominously bizarre atmosphere with sparing shots of Slenderman with the simple plotting and overall themes. You cant really expect a plot that goes anywhere with that simple subject matter. The film does drag on in between the creepy scenes with the annoying actresses brooding on in their personal terrors. Another huge problem is that Slenderman shows up maybe a total 2 min of the entire film combined, and the scares are very cliche and standard when he's sparingly featured. There is one sequence in the library that is done properly and has a considerable amount of decent scare ambition. The sound design and effects were firing on all cylinders throughout the film and created some very good sonic tension at times. There was also a considerably solid amount of solid camerawork throughout. Before you know it the film is over and the finale is ok at best but very abrupt. This film is the epitome of middle of the road cliche horror with some decent ambition at times, and is in no way deserving of such an embarrassing low rating.
It was so bad... the ending was terrible. The characters were boring. Waste of time. Dont bother watching this

Can this even be called a movie? I'm wondering if some of this trash can be reviewed before it hits theaters and online streaming. Please avoid seeing this movie. Don't waste time with the trailer either!

review_title: Fake user reviews...dont listen. Bad movie. (Spoilers)
It's Just As Bad As Everyone Says
review_detailed_main:
Pros: 1. The film is competently shot. It's nothing special but it gets the job done. 2. The grey, black and blue colour palette cements an empty and oppressive atmosphere. 3. There are a few genuinely creepy moments that send shivers down your spine. 4. The sound-mixing is fantastic and it does the heavy-lifting in regards to creating the tension and suspense.

Cons: 1. The dialogue is often very clunky which makes the character interactions feel forced. 2. The score is massively overused and overbearing. 3. For some strange, and unexplored, reason, Mr. Jensen (Kevin Chapman) suspects and attacks Hallie (Julia Goldani Telles) for kidnapping Katie (Annalise Basso). 4. There are a plethora of idiotic character decisions which are clearly just inserted for forced horror and drama moments. 5. Most of the jump-scares are obnoxious and they fail to land. 6. The character and plot development are pretty much nonexistent, which makes it extremely difficult for you to care for any of the characters, or for what's going on. 7. The editing in the horror scenes is over-the-top and ridiculously stupid. 8. The CGI looks absolutely awful. 9. The acting is stale and obviously forced at times.

Well ok then. I'm always curious when I see dead low rated films such as this, because I like wondering if it's being harshly criticised or not.

First 45 minutes or so of this film I was genuinely sold, plot was making sense. You had this mysterious creature following them etc it had the makings of a good horror. But oh my word does this plot fall apart.

1: the "mysterious" slender man isn't mysterious anymore as he appears on screen every 5 minutes or so. Completely gives the mystery away. 2: nothing made sense. This slender man just invented his "powers" the longer it went on and absolutely nothing was explained at all. It was all just stupid. 3: ending was an absolute joke. It summed up the entire 2nd half of the film. Absolute waste of time, a good ending could have saved this from being a low rating (4 I gave is generous), but no. I don't want to use spoilers, but it's the most pointless ending to a film I've seen. NOTHING GETS ANSWERED. I'm actually sat here fully triggered at the ending! 4: it wasn't scary. The very few jump scares that were used you knew were coming so it had no effect.

It could have been good. That's what annoys me more, because it really did start well. But my god that 2nd 45 minutes is absolutely awful. I don't recommend tbh

review_title: Not very scary, but very funny
review_detailed_main: This film was competently shot, had some spooky imagery, a very nice location and was unintentionally one of the funniest movies I've ever seen. This film was absolutely hilarious, nothing made any sense and it was glorious. Definitely a great watch if you want to unwind or have a good laugh with some friends but if you want some good horror, you best look elsewhere, although I will give credit where it's due and that is that there was some scary imagery in there but they were far and few between. Definitely a great romp with friends.

Slender man is a cinematic timeless neo-classical masterpiece of the horror movie genre. The genre of horror movies has long been notorious for bad films, with cheesy acting, characters and plot lines. Many of these so bad it's good films are b movies with low budgets. Slenderman creates a true and flawless recreation of this genre. The actors playing the main group of girls in this movie performed perfectly, managing to create humor through lines clearly written by writers out of touch with teenage social life while remaining completely serious. The writers of the film alone deserve a huge amount of credit for making the film the masterpiece that it was. The dialogue replicating the type of unintentional humor scenes in movies like the Room while not trying too hard to be humorous as to disrupt the movie. The dialogue between the characters illustrated just how out of touch the writers were with teenagers and high school social life, creating hilarious and absurd scenes such as the scene where the characters exclude Hallie's little sister from hanging out with them despite the fact that she's practically the same age and they really have no social standing in the first place to warrant this. This scene truly encapsulated the cheesy and artificial chemistry we see between teenagers in typically low budget movies, but to see this on such a high budget was great to see.

At the base layer of the composition of this film is a nostalgic replication of the classic horror movie plots, that pays homage to the genre of cheesy monster movies. The movie mostly revolves around a girl getting kidnapped and her friends seeking to find her, without consulting adults who are largely absent in the film. Rather than consulting the police or attempting an exorcism, the movie's characters ignore most obvious options and constantly take matters into their own hands which is truly reminiscent of the cheesy horror movie genre in general.

Truly a feat of this film is its ability to keep the audience engaged. The downfall of most cheesy horror movies is that they are a slog to get through. However slenderman keeps the viewer interested through it's downright absurdity at failed attempts to create a villain. This is another strong point of the movie. Slenderman is such a classic urban legend, and has become the boogie man of the post 9/11 generation, who have grown up in a culture that creates a fear of strangers among youth. It is this constant worry that something bad will happen that allowed the myth of slenderman to be such a terrifying character in he first place, not to mention his relation to technology and the metaphor of slenderman being manifested in technology. The representation of slenderman in this movie misses the mark completely, creating a monster that is not scary at all and arguably likeable. Slenderman does not have a defined character, and is more of just a guy kills people. That's it. It is almost like the influences he has in terms of nightmares and otherwise are completely separate from his character. This really allows for the actors and plot elements to shine as the star of the show, being the most entertaining things about the movie.

I believe that the Slender Man film was originally much more developed, as the trailers vastly differ from the movie itself. The trailers show an entirely different plot that seems less rushed and much more planned out. This is possibly the reason for the scenes changing so abruptly, to the point where the viewer is confused. This is one of the things that makes the film so comedic, because a "scary" scene ends up becoming downright hilarious. The trailer also shows the girl who goes missing in the film, Katie, come out of the woods covered in blood, something that downright never made it into the final cut of the movie. I believe that the directors decided that the movie would have a better role as a comedic film. This was a great decision as it sets Slender Man apart from your run of the mill horror film that gives the movie with such a generic modern horror villain a certain spirit that is not commonly found in big budget horror productions.

Overall slenderman is a hilarious film that is fun for the whole family. It's poor writing and bad acting clash with its high budget and big Hollywood production style, creating a type of movie rarely seen in the big budget Hollywood scene. It truly is a victory for the genre of comically bad movies, that fits in with its contemporaries like the room. If you want to make your kid not afraid of Slenderman, show them this film.

-Rolf

I think personally, that Slender Man should have gotten more reviews!! The jump scares were really good and terrifying! They did an excellent job with the fear of Slender Man and the affect he gives on his victims. Though I do admit that the dialogue between some of the characters was a bit cheesy and they could of made slender man look more realistic, despite that in my personal opinion the film is worth watching! :)

I had hoped that this would tell the story of the girls who had tried to murder their friend, because of their slender man obsession. Although that wasn't the case, I still had gone to see the movie thinking it might be a good supernatural thriller. The CGI was atrocious, cast was subpar, and only a few moments were actually original. Just avoid this trash.

I remember when Slenderman was good. When the lore itself scared the absolute ba-jeez-us out of me. That was in 2009 - 2013. Fast forward 5 years later, it's the most overused thing in the creepy pasta fandom.

Just from the trailer, I could tell that this would be a bland and unoriginal movie, and boy, was I right. This is more of a random short film you would find on YouTube, normally filmed by college students on an iPhone 6 rather than a big production company.

The movie uses too many overused things, like forests, maggots, hallucinations, and others you'd probably find in the "My first horror movie starter pack" or any other crappy-pasta.

In conclusion, this movie uses far too many dead topics and other lores. This movie is in no way creative and is straight up plagiarising the original creepy-pasta instead of coming up with another way to tell the story.

After all, Slenderman isn't that scary anymore. It's either the plot writers and creative producers live in 2009 or they seriously have no imagination when it comes to producing horror movies. Enough said.

review_title: Puts the Blair Witch Project to shame

review_title: I was a waste of time
review_detailed_main: I was expecting something else... the only thing that I enjoyed from this film was the music at the end when the credits appeared. I'm not going to judge what people have to say about it. If you enjoyed the film then good for you. :)

This movie is a shambolic display and to extrapolate all the issues would simply take too long. The year is 2018 and jump scares are lazily juxtaposed with generic horror music as a feeble attempt to scare the audience. More yawns featured than any sort of grip on an even worse element of the movie ... the plot Cliche after cliche assumed its position with constant dream wake ups and no progression , character development or flow. If you wanted to get really pissed drunk watch this movie and play "what will happen next" I guarantee even your friend who never watches movies will guess everything right , just be careful he/she doesn't puke at the end ... not from the alcohol ... but from the sheer atrocity this film emitted over 90 odd minutes . Awful awful movie , and I stress movie never a film

review_detailed_main: I'm honestly very confused about the fact that 3 is the overall rating for this movie, it deserves way better! It was actually scary, I jumped several times and I liked how the storyline moved quickly. It wasn't slow at all. I liked it! Definitely worth $16 at the movies

This movie was so bad made bad didn't make any sense. Would not watch it again even if it comes on tv . It didn't have a real story line it wasn't worth watching. Please don't waist your money to watch it .

review_title: Too bad to even get a laugh out of
review_detailed_main:
I'd read the reviews prior to viewing but I regularly find myself enjoying horror films many don't appreciate... in this case though I should've listened. I left wanting a refund for a film I got a free ticket to

To describe it in short, it was like watching a film made by middle school students who just learnt how to use Adobe After Effects and gotten over excited about it. The acting was so cringe it became harder and harder to watch as the film went on however I've seen these actors in other work and I'm going to have to blame it on direction and writing here. The Slender Man concept, although slightly outdated had so much potential but unfortunately was made into one big snooze fest. The major fault here was showing Slender Man, thus eliminating all suspense and having to rely on underwhelming jump scares and making the audience wait for some sort of twist that never comes. If this film was created the exact same but produced 10 years ago for a teen audience I think it would haver received a much better reception.

If you're as excited or intrigued as I was about this film, watch it by all means but go into it with extremely low expectations so it is at least borderline bearable
The most entertaining part of the 1 hour 30 minutes runtime was when I went pee

It's juvenile, boring & extremely stupid. If you have to see it, wait until it comes out on a movie channel. Please. It's beyond idiotic.

review_title: Pretty bad, boring, choppy story, amateurish at times
review_detailed_main: The movie doesn't make sense at times, likely due to editing to get to PG-13 from R. The performances suffer due to poor direction and editing. It's boring and bland. At many points it seems that you're watching a student film due to laughable effects, editing, and plot points.

I've seen my fair share of bad movies over the years, but seriously this movie is it's own genre of bad. I know it was made based on an internet meme, but I can't find a real plot, or any reason to be invested in it. The movie was actually difficult to watch all the way through, not because it was scary, but because the story was so very bad.

Apparently two two words doesnt count as a review so to to sum up this film...

Just no.

While I never viewed any of the trailers and didn't set any expectations, this still managed to be just as bad as others thought. One might say that this would've been more liked, if it was released 6 years years ago, and I would agree with it. The whole mythology is actually intresting, but not enough to fuel this drag of a movie filled with cheap jumpscares...

review_title: What is with all the hate...?
review_detailed_main: After reading all of the hate on this movie, I still paid to go see it and it was better than expected!! No it is NOT going to be like the video game, which I assume is where all the hate came from, so please let the hate go. It is a great movie and whether you're a fan of the video game or not I recommend you go see it! The girls are all hot, especially Joey King! The acting is great and it's over the top creepy!! The setting of the woods was perfect. And it's non stop horror after the first 10-15 mins! Definitely a must see!!

review_title: What the hell is everyone's problem?
Slender Man should've taken me instead.
review_detailed_main: Five years too late I'm afraid, although to be quite frank the year of release does not matter. It's still a terrible film regardless. Have Hollywood seriously run out of ideas that they are now resorting to popular viral memes? 'The Bye Bye Man' meets 'The Ring' with a sprinkle of every other generic horror film from the past ten years. Was so close to walking out, honestly. A small group of friends watch a video that will "summon Slender Man", which consequently allows the titular mythological being to haunt them and possibly "take them to a secret world". Aside from the dreary cinematography and a decent performance from King, there is nothing to make me recommend this. Nothing! For a creature that's supposed to be well hidden, he seems to be flipping damn everywhere. Does Slender Man ever catch a break? Is this his full time job? Stalking children and taking them? I wonder what we could compare that to...(hint: a well-dressed pedophile)! Sorry not sorry. It's just another case of stupid characters doing insufferably stupid things. "Don't watch the video", "Ok I won't"...guess what? They watched it. "Don't take your blindfold off", "Ok I won't"...guess what? They did. The constant prowling in the woods in the middle of the night in total solitude was relentlessly dumb. Of course he is going to take you, you're all practically offering yourselves to him! Want me to make a sign for you? "We luv Slender Man. Take us! xoxox". Christ! The reliance of jump scares is fine, I expected it. But when they aren't even frightening, it just infuriates me. Enough with the loud pointless noises of someone walking! The cheap visual effects and horrifically terrible ending was the icing on the cake. I was done. No more. I'm out. Slender Man, I offer myself to you. Take me or, better yet, take your inept film and merge it into a tree.

review_title: Better than I expected, but that really doesn't say much.

review_detailed_main: While the game was great and fun to play, this movie is a complete disgrace to it. Everything about the movie was bad, from the crappy jump scares to crappy character development. This is one of few movies I've seen where I wish I could get a refund....

First of all, if you're expecting a good horror movie (like there are a lot nowadays), stop expecting. Here's why:

The film makes use of a small cast mainly consisting out of teenage characters. Here's why 70% of the movie consists out of high school- peer pressure, teenage romance, girls bitchfighting and family problems. Fun for some people maybe but for a horror maybe not so suitable. So its all about the small teen cast consisting out of 4 girls who are played by women I didn't even knew before. None of the acting is really worth mentioning but the actress playing the girl Wren does a decent job in my opinion.

Then on to the horror part of the movie. It's all about our man Slenderman ofcourse. The ones who've played the game will know how he looks like and I can tell you: he looks exactly the same. Even the quality is the same. Its actually a very bad quality CGI/effect that runs through this movie. A highschooler could've done the same job. After the movie i noticed an actor was hired to play slenderman but this seems rather useless due to what's mentioned above.

The jumpscares in the movie are rather cheap, nothing you haven't seen before. Even sometimes a bit funny due to the crappiness of the effects.

Storyline has some big holes and character development is a mess, you're left with a lot of questions afterwards.

I'll suggest everyone who's not a fan of Slenderman but just curious about him to play one of the games that are released about this character, you'll get the same as the movie but even better.

This movie is absolute garbage! Will never watch again. It didn't keep my interest! It wasn't that scary. There was a few parts where I jumped...because something comes out of nowhere but don't waste your time...or your money!!

Who asked for this movie? I'm not a good critic but like any other person in this world would say, this movie is boring pointless and dragged on. Half the stuff doesn't make sense and it's not scary what so ever. I haven't even finished the movie yet and I'm writing this review (1 hr 15mins into the movie and I'm still awake somehow) don't waste your time watching this movie

I was kind of expecting this movie to be a let down but I thought it was going to be a "so bad it's good" thing. But nope this movie was a boring mess. That is all I have to say, no spoilers that is all I have to say.. that this movie was so boring!

1/10
Here I was thinking it was gonna be a solid movie like the game but it was just a really bad LSD trip

No it is not the Conjouring, Sinister or the Sixth Sense but it is a great watch. We were sitting as deeply into our seats as we could cringing over what was coming next. Truly creepy fun scary movie night.

Said movie then features in theaters and you are left disappointed because the movie did not deliver what was offered nor did it even meet any expectation I had for it (whether I based it off the trailer or even if there had been no trailer, the general knowledge of the legend just as itself), thus taking its hype and general quality down. This movie was definitely way better than the reviews on here give it credit for. It was a good balance between loud, scary, and suspenseful. I would definitely recommend this movie if you're looking for the newest thriller!
Boring, predictable, bad acting, decent special effects with some creepy imagery. This could have been much better but just wasn't.

Don't bother............. For real. Just don't.

Don't.

This is probably one of the worst horror movies in 2018. Most of the jump scares are laughable, bland characters and bad plot. The only good thing about this movie is the quick ending so I could get this movie over and done with.

I don't know what I was expecting when I went see the movie. Somehow I was positive, I like the subject and I thought that after all the Marble Hornets and whatever else was there - a proper cinematic take with solid budget would produce a decent result.

Well... Is that the curse of video game movies? I suppose that's the closest explanation. They can't for the life of them stick to the core material. None of them. Of course, it might not have been better to have one and a half hour of white noise and weeping angels, but then again they could've taken some notes from Marble Hornets. Mixing that and the core game material, adding some coherence, pacing and relevant plot...

Instead they just went for the lowest common denominator. Four teenage girls do something predictably stupid in an attempt to show that girls are apparently no different from boys when it comes to being stupid. Well, goal achieved. Then somebody goes missing and the rest start to dig around for exposition. Which, of course, provokes numerous repetitive, predictable and, frankly, yawn-boring Paranormal Activity moments, all of which include and suggest that Slender Man is impervious to anything, doesn't have any particular moral center and that the girls are just screwed. That much becomes apparent almost one third into the movie. Yet they will still do this and that, one stupid thing here, another there, an ear-cringe fest at the house or the library... At least "It" was artistic, this thing is just basic demon hallucination with lots of... well, not even noise. Because I wouldn't mind white noise, but they had to make Slender Man into a Leshy, or, rather, Spirit of the Woods from Witcher - and that felt absolutely out of place. Sure, we've seen sight-based monsters before, though not on the big screen, so maybe literally replicating the game wouldn't be smart, but Slender Man is a psychological horror. It's the embodiment of paranoia, of being watched, followed. It's like a proper "It Follows", which is also quite a terrible movie, but still far better represents the subject.

The problem of this movie is that if you changed the CGI\the dummy from Slender Man to ANYTHING else - the movie would barely change. Babadook, It, It Follows, Paranormal Activity, Insidious - you change the monster for any of these and the movie could very well go exactly the same. You don't have to change a single line of the plot. Maybe if this was a 90-ies movie - it could resound better, but nowadays you just feel that you've "seen" that before. And what you hoped to see - isn't there.

I always like when characters try to take themselves seriously, or fight back. Clear Rivers in Final Destination 2 locking herself in the asylum, for example. It means that the writers want to explore, to tackle the subject, to toy with the viewer. Of course, when it becomes a monster slasher, like "It" - it kind of loses the mark, but if they have so much exposition, if they have introduced even the characters' friends, who, somehow, are involved - then why not work with it. Or, at least, make the conclusion properly tragic and realistic, like in Krampus.

But no, no no no. Again, they went with all the easiest solutions. It's almost like they were forced to write\make this movie, and, obviously, people have to work. The question is - why is it always wrong people working in the wrong places... The only reason I give this thing 2 stars is because it's about Slender Man. Though I'd personally recommend this film as a stoner film. It might be enjoyable to be watched intoxicated, simply laughing at every stupid scene.

This movie is absolute garbage just another abomination of a movie made from a video game the movie is not scary at all as to how the slender game is if you want a slender man scare play the video game because you won't get it here
Terrible movie. Don't watch it. It's not scary at all and just lost of time

review_detailed_main: The trailer for this movie gave me high hopes it looked creepy and scary and like a really good movie. But I was very disappointed the actors weren't that great, the storyline for the movie didn't really make a whole lot of sense. They could have done so much better with this movie. review_title: It's as faceless as it's monster. The Slender Man is a giant bore with no plot, no characters, little narrative and one of the worst scripts for a horror film
review_detailed_main:
Okay, I guess its time to talk about urban legends on the Internet. Though I have my fair share of videos and channels I'll watch on YouTube, I'm not one to read fully into local stories about people claiming they saw things like clowns and monsters in the woods. Probably one that took the web by storm was Slender Man. I know the suit wearing, faceless thing has a backstory on websites, but the furthest knowledge I have comes from a video game that I played a while back. While I wasn't scared of this like a lot of survival games, it did give a spooky atmosphere and a lot of people did play it. And yes, I do know about the tragic stabbing that happened by two teenage girls who believed in Slender Man and wanted to impress him.

Now while he was big, that was almost four or five years ago. Like a lot of video games, anything revolving around the internet tends to have s short popularity window. This is why we have gotten very few movies based off of Internet memes. On the one hand, it's hard to see why a Slender Man movie got made, but I do see the potential.

In the New England area, we have four teenage friends; Wren (played by Joey king), Hallie (played by Julia Goldani Telles), Chloe (played by Jaz Sinclair) and Katie (played by Annalise Basso). They act like how a lot of high-schoolers, just trying to get through class, hoping to get the popular guy and trying to have fun. When they hear a group of boys admitting they were going to try and summon the "Slender Man", the girls decide to do the same. They go to a webpage and watch a hypnotic video that seems to invoke something.

A few days later on a class trip, Katie goes missing and both Wren and Hallie figure it has to do with Slender Man. They spend a good chunk of the movie attempting to look into it's history and how it might be responsible for a lot of other missing children. The further they dive into the mystery, the more their lives start to become affected by occasional dreams and sights of the Slender Man. More people go mossing and they see more abstract images even if their the only ones that can see them. Can they figure out where their friends are?

Where do I begin with Slender Man? I can start by saying that the concept of watching a forbidden video has already been done with in The Ring. The idea of doing it on the Web isn't a bad idea, but I can a hundred percent guarantee that nothing new is added here. For a movie that took four years to make, it steals from other horror movies like The Ring, I Know What You Did Last Summer, The Grudge, and The Craft. The cinematography is even shot like one of those films from the late 1990's.

The worst thing about it is The Slender Man is dull and boring. The characters have no personality, there's little narrative plot, no focus, and it keeps witching points of narrative at complete random. It might focus on Joey King as a main character, before switching to another girl while throwing her out. It's like the movie couldn't decide if the movie should be a group story or something more personal. The Slender Man feel like random notes from a horror film fanatic who went insane. I swear, this was a tough movie to get through. I can't imagine even the most hardcore fans of Slender Man even liking this.

I'll give this two slender men out of ten. It's a bad sign when I went to see this with a bunch of teenagers who were silent for the majority with no laughs, no screams, or even that much interest. This is one legend that will not last.

Slender Man is a movie about an iconic creepy figure that is usually put into old time photos that a myth was built upon much like the Mothman. In the myth people end up just vanishing and this movie does a good job portraying that.

A lot of people seem to be complaining that there is no "gore" or that the character's just "Vanish" But that is the point of it, even during the movie it makes mention to how the Slender Man effects a person's mind. Either way, take it for what it is, a creepy horror film, not some slasher that most seemed to have expected (for some reason).

It was an enjoyable watch, not an amazing movie, but enjoyable.
Was disappointed that all the previews weren't in the movie.

I could go on forever with my gripes about this movie, but I will confine this review to its most annoying flaw: lighting. Considering most of the film is shot in a forest at night, you'd think the filmmakers would be sure to make that footage clearly definable for an audience. But no, we aren't that lucky. In these wooded scenes, we get the classic "screen's too bright, so this black is actually a light grey" and everything is indecipherable. We get layers of different shades of black, and hardly anything can be seen. So, ultimately, you're paying to see a film that you can't even see most of the runtime. Of course a fan of the movie may argue that this is on purpose to create a mysterious atmosphere, blah blah blah. I've seen enough films to know that this error is plain and simply that: an error. There have been dozens of terrible Slender Man films, and this is no exception; don't let its semi-blockbuster-looking production fool you.

review_title: As a connoisseur of trash horror movies
review_detailed_main: This is worse than bye-bye man. I have had this account for 4 years and never have I felt so assaulted that I finally left a review. Cinematography - there is 1 cool shot in the movie. If you go into the movie asking "what is this shot trying to convey?" get ready for a lot of frustration. I wanted to like this movie, and I wanted it to succeed. It did not. There is no passion, and no attempt to scare. Plot - the plot is weak and without imagination. Woah the kids saw a scary video and now the monster is going to get them! Characters - par for the course in horror movies which is to say terrible. Sound design - cliche to the point of nausea. Please save your money and wait until you can see this for free. I had quite a bit to drink hoping to make this a great experience but even that was not enough. Even sloshed I was bored out of my mind and constantly questioning who could have made a movie this devoid from the average person.

review_title: Do not waste your hard earned money....
review_detailed_main: There is no easy way to say it but this movie is simply boring. It is not even a RedBox material.

What an utter pile of trite this film was. At best, the acting was passable. There weren't any actors that I would say are phenomenal, but they were average. As for the visual effects, I will say that they were decent as well. As for the whole idea behind the Slender Man itself, I have no issues with because for there is little to no official backstory behind this internet boogeyman, so the film not really going into an explanation of what he is or where he came from is a nonissue.

What is an issue is characters. All of the characters in the film hardly have personalities aside from the cliché tropes that horror films use. Because of this, the film fails to keep you invested with the characters making their inevitable confrontation with the titular man in black lacking. This is one of the issues that several horror films share: these characters are not people. They are only there as disposable cannon fodder to be killed. As such, it's hard to care about the characters when they are in grave danger because you have no reason to.

The film uses the same tired horror tropes that most average horror films employ such as using loud noises or jumpscares. Ultimately, they do nothing to mix it up or add a new spin on it. The Slender Man itself even looks bad given how it is poorly CGI-rendered. It could give one memories of 2017's The Bye Bye Man because it looks like the developers of the film took a snap of Slender Man from that 2012 game and poorly implemented it into the movie.

Unsurprisingly, Slender Man is another bad film brought to you by Sony Pictures that is around four or five years too late. At the very least, the film is a riot to laugh at.

review_title: I wish the Slender Man would kill me
review_detailed_main: Okay so a slender man movie could be really cool, by why on EARTH did they wait this long to make a theatrical studio slender man film? The character has been outdated for like 6 years now, and NOW is the time you want to make it? Well maybe in those many overlong years they thought of something really good? Hahaha, no. Wishful freakin thinking. Instead, Slender Man is literally as bad as they get. Just think Bye Bye Man mixed with Jeepers Creepers 3 bad. The directing is really awful and it most of the editing and shots are super lazy and boring. It feels like they just got the director of one of those crappy teen dance movies..oh, wait, that's exactly what they did! And it shows. Most of the actors are bad but it usually looks like poor direction than bad acting. The script SUUUUUUUCKS and is literally the most cliche modern horror film ever, like a computer wrote it or something. The Slender man himself acts nothing like he does in the games or in the lore, and he actually runs around chasing people and roaring! Remember back in the awesome game when he just stands there staring at you from a distance? Remember how haunting that was how he didn't even move? Well now he runs and chases people like a zombie from The Walking Dead. Worst of all, the film just isn't scary and instead it's attempts to scare you are just really funny! You're blind if you don't see 99% of the jump scares coming and most of them are over the dumbest things. There's a scene with a girl in a library and you know a jump scare is coming...and it's just the librarian who walks past the camera in the most boring unclimatic way possible, like the director told her to not be scary...but the music is SO INTENSE when it happens, like this librarian walking past the camera was just the freakiest thing in the history of cinema! The entire movie is like this, just a painfully generic and boring modern horror film with nothing interesting, unique, fresh, or good. I gave it a bonus star because SOME of the cinematography shots are nice, and the musical score is occasionally good, although still a bit basic. Without those two things, this movie would be a hard 1/10 and the worst horror film since Jeepers Creepers 3.

Lots of trees, fog, shadowy figure, crooked gate scenes fill this movie. Scariest part, weren't none! Even the prosthetically altered moderately slender man looked halloweenish. DVD cover looked scary though.
I was very hesitant to even watch this because the reviews are so bad. Honestly I dont know why.. it was a great movie.

review_title: Don't know what people are on about.
review_detailed_main: So this movie has gotten alot of negative reviews, and I have no idea why. The acting was completely fine, dialogue was on point as well (in the German version at least). The effects were of a surprising variety and even the sudden change of style added to the suspension. I especially like the lack of gore in this movie, as it keeps Slenderman itself somewhat mysterious. The story was solid, nothing new but definely not bad. There were some new ideas to build up suspension, one in particular caught my eye and I like it alot: the video-call scene where Slenderman haunts one of the girls from his perspective, yet is nowhere to be seen. If all you want is gore, this movie probably isn't the one for you, but otherwise it should be pretty fun to watch, even though the ending is a little disappointing.

I've never been more disappointed in such a potentially epic terror. Flat characters left the entire story line a snooze between jump scares. The best part of the movie was "the nun" trailer in the previews.

Absolute GARBAGE! The plot was dryer than my phone, and thats pretty dry. The horror factors of the movie were all based off jumpscares. I could bring my 8 children to watch this and they would sleep peacefully. I wasted money on gas, tickets, and food to see this. The previews before the movie were scarier than the movie itself. If I could give it 0 stars, I would.

First of all, how did this garbage get green-lighted? I've made better low budget horror films with friends. I knew in the first ten minutes that the movie was garbage. The Slenderman wasn't scary at all and was shown way too much. Bad writing is always covered up by cheap "jump" scares. Good horror movies have a great build up and suspense and the really good ones make you not want to look at the screen anymore. When I first saw the commercial I laughed because by now we've all seen so many of these that we know what is good and what's bad. This director and writer should never be allowed to create another horror film. Hire someone who knows how to make one. What a waste of money. Slenderman, Bye Bye Man. Is this what Hollywood has to offer? What happened to real horror? Guess its time for another Rob Zombie trailer park horror film. Haven't seen ten of those before.
I go to the theater. I wait 20 mintues and there still isn't any sign of Slendertman. All I'm seeing are some kids!! What Slandermon flick is this I need more slenderman.

I almost fell asleep watching this and the way slenderman looks is just funny xD

in a game it is okay and scary but the whole atmosphere in this movie is not making me feel it's a horror

review_title: Well made horror movie. Not so scary, but good to watch
review_detailed_main:
I don't understand why this movie receives so much hate. I guess it's because some people expected more from the premise. I on the other hand went in without any expectations, as I know nothing of Slender Man other than it was also a horror video game.

What appealed most to me was actually the cinematography. There were some some really tasteful shots in the movie. I felt the makers were very creative this way. Also the actresses appealed to me. I didn't know them at all, but I believe they portrayed their roles well, and I would like to see more of their skills.

I will concede that the movie was not unforgivably scary like some of the horror movies that come out these days. But I actually like this. Not everyone is in the market to see a horror movie that will make them lose sleep for the coming three months. This movie gets the juices flowing, but you still can sleep afterwards. That's a plus for me.

I believe this movie is definitely worth the watch. I cannot judge however it provides good hommage to the source material, as I'm not familiar with it.

I've seen a fair bit of horror movies over the years. This was among the more creepy ones. It creates great atmosphere, and builds anxiety every time the characters are in the dark.

I don't know why it is getting so much hate in the reviews and has such a low rating. It was certainly not deserved. I had never read the story, watched the trailer or known the back story, so there's that. All I had seen were a couple still images, which definitely evoked some intrigue.

At the end of the day, judging it on its own merits, I enjoyed it. I would have given it 8/10 but it got a bit cheesy at the end. It made me want to yell out "stranger things". Not that Stranger Things is cheesy. You'll see what I mean.
Horribly written and acted, lacking visuals, baffling odd plot framing (including underdeveloped subplots that didn't need to be there). It lived up to the question "Why the hell make this now?"

review_title: It Tries to Hit and it Misses
Not as bad as everyone says, but it is very mediocre.
review_detailed_main:
So is Slender Man really that bad? NO,but it isn't good either. I'll need to justify what did i just say about this film.

Story and characters

Dumb teenage girls summon creature and get killed one by one. Okay so story isn't interesting at all, in fact it's one of the worst examples of uninspiring writing and story telling. Characters are really dumb and generic as well, with no personality to speak off. There is girl that dies first, token black girl, suspicious girl and girl that believes in legend.

Cinematography, acting and sound

To it's defense there were some cool and good looking scenes, especially how some of the camera angles were utilized. But really it relied to much on the cheap stock footage effects and facial close ups. Effects were overall alright, but you can clearly see that budget was lacking to make it look good. Acting was horrendous, wooden and over-exaggerated, with some cringe worthy moments in between. Sound was well used and it did fit the scenes really well, but like some effects, they used way to much stock footage like sounds for moments, although they were well utilized.

Enjoyment and verdict

I really enjoyed this movie, for all it's lack of creativity and scary scenes, it made me realize that this isn't really a boring movie, rather a really generic one. If you like Slenderman, you'll probably enjoy it, but if not skip it.

5/10

review_title: What is up with the lighting
review_detailed_main:
There is nothing more disappointing than a promising trailer that shows the best scenes but is actually advertising a huge disappointment in the shape of a film.

You'd think by now film makers would know not to use clichés, because they make the film too predictable, especially when it came to jump scares, making this film such a bore. I couldn't wait for it to be over.

I could excuse the bad acting, cause yes, the actresses probably did the best they could with a bad script. The script did not bother to make the group of girls original or likeable, the one thing accurately shown about them is what teens do when they get together. However the lighting was unforgivable. I don't know where their budget went but they should have invested in a few more lights, as it was really hard to make things out (even though I was watching with the brightness to the max) and the shades being sliced in clear lines did not make it in the least a professional looking production.

I know they probably really tried to have the climax of the film be all creepy, but again, clichés. There was a clear lack of originality but one aspect of the film that was actually a little redeemable was their one use of trees at the end of the film; that was interesting, but I wouldn't say it's worth watching the film for that.

review_title: I guess the Lost Pages were of the script
review_detailed_main:
Slender Man is a confusing abomination that is barely watchable and doesn't make a lick of sense despite very little actually happening throughout the entire film. There was a real life murder over Slender Man some while back, and for some reason Sony decided to whip this movie together and then back out after realizing it might be a tad tasteless or offensive, and thus they cut it down drastically and that's how we're left with this hollow husk of a movie that has to be seen for one to understand just how broken it is. It's possibly comparable to The Snowman, but I haven't seen that one. If you watch the trailers for Slender Man, and then the movie, you'll notice the boyfriend character from the trailer fails to make an appearance and several shots from the trailer alone fail to appear.

What I think needed to be done to make this film worthwhile would be to have upped the ante if anything, making it more violent and wallowing in the tasteless nature of it, or making it a documentary on the real life murder, which is a vastly scarier and darker tale than the hogwash we get here. None of the characters are memorable whatsoever as they are all basically the same generic teenage girl characters, interchangeable from one another and equally ditsy with insane lines of logic throughout which somehow work out in one way or another due to plot convenience and poor writing and very little effort given in this project as a whole. This is only furthered with abhorrent pacing, with many slow, meandering shots thrown in of supposed visions, which are ultimately time-fillers to reach the 90 minute mark with inoffensive cheap shots of the wilderness. The image quality is downright gross and it's one of the hardest films to stare at for prolonged periods of time due to its disgusting color palette, horrible filters, and dull shot compositions.

This movie is one of the most boring pieces of rubbish ever made, and thus I can't even recommend it as so bad it's good, because you're likely to fall asleep rather than so much as chuckle.

The movie was mediocre and could have been creepier. Channel Zero also from creepy pasta is an anthology series and has done a great job at creating fear. This movie dropped the ball I expected a lot sacrier.

Creepy Pasta, FYI, is a mash-up of 'creepy' and 'cut and paste', from other horrors tories. And oh, does it rely on copying for it's story. How many cliches can you spot? Bunch of high school friends summon hold a seance to summon the boogie-man, it all goes a bit wrong, they don't tell the parents, shots of trees at night eerm let's try and banish him etc.etc. Lots of shots of girls holding each other and screaming, and at the end someone walks through a gate. The end. Of a movie you have already seen before.

You know, I actually think the Slender Man mythos is quite interesting and has potential as a movie. And if I try real hard, perhaps I can forget that this trainwreck exists and hope some one will make a decent movie out of the background material, in the near future.

The story is horrible and so is the acting. I am fairly certain I can produce better effects myself in MS Paint. The screen is also so dark, that you would think you were watching a certain episode of Game of Thrones.

One could go into details but much like the people behind this movie must have thought all through the creation of this garbage: why bother?

Slender man was your typical low budget horror movie that tries hard to scare the audience, but falls apart like a pair of cheap shoes.

The good - the movie doesn't rely on constant jump scares, murdered animals, & faux blood. The actresses try to put on a decent performance but fall flat. The special FX were decently done. When you finally see old SM he's more cool looking than scary. The banter between the girls was realistic. The madness scenes were spot on, but outcome was predictable.

The bad - too dark and you couldn't see what was going on. You learn about the lore towards the end of the 2nd act so at that point (if you are still watching) no longer invested.

The ugly - w/o going into spoiler territory...screamy teen girls. This movie could have been a metaphor for drugs, growing up or puberty.

Conclusion: I think it was a missed opportunity. If the actors, set pieces, and director were the same but different script it might have worked.

Also - there could have been many ways to do a slender man story without paralleling the real life events... if they were that worried about offending the real life people they could have taken one of those avenues... instead we're left with half of a movie using the blandest scenes they had. I thought it was well acted, not too over the top screamy, with a certain degree of naivety. It is a bit of a slow burner, but engaging, and builds the suspense all the way through. If you enjoy supernatural Horror movies, and aren't looking for skull crushing, eyeball popping gore from the first scene, you should enjoy this.

Horror films are not even remotely frightening if you can't see what's going on. A bunch of screaming people running about in a pitch black scene with some booming sound effects doesn't work.

If we can't see what's going on at all, it destroys the tension. If we can clearly see the supernatural monster in daylight, they stop being frightening.

A horror movie only needs to accomplish to very simple but very important things. It needs to be atmospheric and it needs to be scary.

Slender Man is definitely an atmospheric movie. Right from the start, you see the abandoned shopping mall of a sleepy town in the middle of nowhere. Most scenes take place at night, often in dark buildings or in a forest. The progressive confusion, nervosity and terror of the four main characters is also fascinating to watch.

However, the movie isn't scary despite the appropriate atmosphere. The supernatural entity that gave the movie its title is quite unoriginal. It doesn't speak, it doesn't have any unforeseeable powers and it doesn't even have a face which is quite revealing. The weak attempts at jump scares are clumsy and predictable. I would go as far to say that Slender Man is one of the least scariest horror movies I have ever watched and I have come across hundreds.

This would make for an average and quite lukewarm film but there are three minor elements that justify my slightly more positive evaluation. First of all, it's interesting that the movie focuses on four teenage girls instead of just boys or a mixed group which is a little bit different from the usual stereotypes. It's also great that the casting directors and writers didn't try to focus on artificial diversity, including one lesbian girl, one transgender girl, one physically disabled girl and one schizophrenic girl with borderline personality disorder. The four main characters might not have perfect chemistry but their friendship is at least believable. They are refreshingly normal.

Secondly, the young actresses did a solid job. They aren't extraordinary by any means but they made the best they could with an at times shallow and unimaginative script. I really liked Joey King's acting as slightly sinister, nervous and hyperactive teenager who is a little bit different than the other three characters. I happened to find her just memorable and unique enough to not be exaggerated or even annoying.

Thirdly and lastly, I liked how the movie ended. In the beginning, I found the resolution somewhat confusing and short but the more I think about it, the more I find it quite original and even courageous to end a film the way it did here. It's definitely not your standard Hollywood happy ending and this fact alone needs some praise.

In the end, Slender Man is neither an ordinary nor an extraordinary horror film. It has just enough positive elements to be slightly above average or even good. I have seen far worse horror movies recently like Devil's Due or The Quiet Ones. The negative reviews of this film are often exaggerated. Horror movie fans should at least appreciate this film. Teenagers might even like it a little bit more because they could identify with the main characters.

review_title: is it bad that I liked this?

The Story felt lack luster, The CG where tendrils explode through the mirror and where Tom's Head was shaking rapidly and making a distorted face felt unfinished, there was many Cliches and missed opportunities here and there.

Slender Man himself looked pretty amazing, seeing him always left me with a smile on my face. The library scene has to be the best scene in the movie, it is executed very perfectly, and The Scene where Slender Man rises on his tentacles made me smile so wide, teeth were showing.

So overall, not the worst film of the year, not an amazing movie, but I wasn't bored while watching it.

Through a feminist lens and applying environmentalist objectivism, this movie showcases the modern fear of environmental destruction resulting in devastating personal consequences. By making the beloved character of The Lorax into a terrifying emblem of masculinity and misogyny, viewers are left to question their environmental impact and their roles within society.

The frequent symbolism of the oppression of the developing female body manifests through sensationalized imagery about the misunderstandings and stigma again representative of society's views. As feminism and environmentalism often go hand in hand, the film pays homage by using an actual image of a young pregnant woman birthing the roots for a revolution as far as environmental destruction pervades our society.

The scene in the library helps the viewers visualize The Lorax's other hunting ground, as wooden shelves (the tortured and disfigured products of logging) are forced to cradle even more flayed and minced products of deforestation of Mother Earth. The Lorax is angered by this blatant disregard for the gifts of Nature and attacks one of the young women. While herself not a perpetrator of environmental destruction, she is struggling with her own development, and the conflict between environmentalism and feminism is representative of the way the patriarchy turns the oppressed against one another to distract from the oppression they face.

In conclusion, this reinvention of the classic "Lorax" tale showcases the patriarchal fears of the consequences of oppression regarding deforestation and misogyny. The true message, as explained in the final scenes of the film, is that women must embrace environmentalism as a symbiosis to free themselves from misogyny and, at the same time, lift up the most powerful female entity of them all: Mother Nature.

review_title: Creepy story but effects could be better
review_detailed_main:
First of all, I'm not very familiar with the Slender Man lore and have no experience whatsoever on anyhing creepypasta - I hardly even know what that is. So I just watched the movie for what it is, a movie about some scary monster.

I thought it was watchable, somewhat enjoyable, though a little bit slow at times. Everyhting was pretty average. Some cool looking scenes, like the foggy forest. My favorite scene was the video call sequence where the monster(?) calls a person in the house...That was creative and genuinely chilling...a brand new take on the 80's slasher and "Scream" telephone tradition. Also the nightmare scenes with false awakenings and surreal imagery were cool because I like that kind of dreamlike randomness.

In general I felt like the movie was a bit scarier than average horror film. Usually the monster feels just like an enemy and you know the hero is going to find some way to destroy him. But here, the monster is more eerie and abstract and creates an unnerving feeling because you start to fear for the main characters who seem to become more and more helpless against the monster.

The monster itself was done pretty poorly. The concept of the character looks good on paper and has potential for super creepy scenes but that potential was not used very well. Yes, the movie is creepy, but mostly so when the monster is not visible. When he enters the picture the mood goes towards 50s' rubber suit monsters, if you know what I mean...you see the monster from close range and it just looks cheap. But even though the monster effects weren't that good, somehow the movie still has enough scarepower to stay interesting.

I don't know why the movie has gotten so much bottom ratings. My guess is that fans of Slender Man internet stuff are disappointed in the movie and vote it down for protest. But for a regular horror movie watcher I say it's worth checking out once because it does have some creative quality. There are worse ways to spend your autumn night with.
